alert.note: Alert for Cooper (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:01PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cooper County through 530 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bunceton, or 7 miles northwest of Tipton, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Otterville and Bunceton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
